resources.string: Sphere (SPH) indicates the amount of lens power, measured in diopters (D), prescribed to correct your nearsightedness or farsightedness. \n\nIf the value has a minus sign (-), you are nearsighted; if the number has a plus sign (+) or is not preceded by a plus sign or a minus sign, you are farsighted.

Cylinder (CYL) indicates you have a condition where the cornea and/or lens of the eye are irregularly shaped causing blurred vision, in other words, astigmatism. \n\nIt is measured in diopters (D), mostly having a value between 0.00 to +/- 20.00, and go up in steps of 0.25.
Axis indicates the degree of the angle at which the cylinder is placed on your corrective lenses and can be anywhere between 0 and 180 degrees.
Add refers to the additional correction you may need to focus at short distances and is more common over the age of 40.

This only calculates the spherical component of the Rx. It does not change the cylinder, axis or prism components - values from the original Rx would be included for these components along with the calculated sphere power.
Proceed without adding values for Left eye?
Please select a value for \'Add\' for right eye
Please select a value for \'Add\' for left eye
Proceed without adding values for Right eye?
Sphere power is calculated based on 50% of add power and follows \'Over Minus / Under Plus\' rule.
